title: WCAS HISTORY 392-0-26 Topics In History
topic: City States in History, Economics & Politics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course offers students a thematic and methodological approach to Medieval and Early Modern European studies. Students will explore how three academic disciplines - history, economics, and political science - explain one historical phenomenon: the rise and fall of the European city-states. Largely forgotten since the rise of the nation-state, independent cities ruled the middle of Europe from 1100-1600, stretching from the Low Countries in the north, through the German cities and Swiss Confederation, and ending in the Italian city-states. By dividing the course disciplinarily rather than temporally, this course allows students to study in one forum many different methods, theories, and concepts while maintaining a thematic focus. No previous history, economics, or politics experience is required.
